title: Embarrassed Amber Gill left speechless on It Takes Two after 'harsh' criticism
text:

Strictly Come Dancing superfan Amber Gill was left speechless on tonight's It Takes Two after being labelled 'harsh'.

The Love Island winner joined comedian Rufus Hound and presenter Gabby Roslin on the sofa to dissect the celebrities' rehearsal videos.

Amber feared that she was being too harsh while suggesting that YouTube star Saffron Barker needed to "let go a bit more".

She said: "I absolutely love Saffron. I don’t know how she does it. She goes out and give her all, but she just needs to let go a bit more. I feel like I’m being harsh. It's the second week, let her get into her flow."

Then the reality TV star was left red-faced when presenter Gethin Jones joked she was the "harshest judge" on the celebrity panel.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

While looking at footage of Catherine Tyldesley in training, Gethin asked: "What do you reckon Amber? I feel like you’re our harshest judge. Go on. Off you go."

Stunned Amber replied: "I’m the harshest one? Oh no."

The Love Island favourite realised that Gethin was pulling her leg and put her head in her hands as she keeled over.

(Image: ITV)

Gabby revealed that Amber had been "worried" about dishing out criticism to the celeb dancers.

Amber, who also had her say on Alex Jones' rhumba, said: "I love Moana. It's one of my favourite ever films. I hope she brings more energy and sass to the rhumba.

"She needs to put more energy into it and let go a bit more."

(Image: ITV)

She was also stunned that Will Bayley and his pro partner Janette Manrara would be dancing to the Pokemon theme tune.

"I don't know how that adds up to a Paso Doble but I'm waiting to see what they do," confessed Amber.

At the end of the show the panel had to predict who would be next to go - and Amber held up a paddle with David James on.

(Image: ITV)

It Takes Two viewers loved seeing Amber on the celeb superfan panel, but were annoyed that Rufus took up a lot of the talking time.

"Oh, great, Rufus Hound. Be ready to not get a word in, ladies," said one viewer.

Added another: "Yeah I’m a bit behind, but OMG, shut up, Rufus. They weren’t asking you!"

"Amber not really getting a word on edgeways on #fridaypanel," said a third.

A fourth said: "Amber from love island on the friday panel, love that for me x"

*Strictly - It Takes Two airs weeknights on BBC One at 5.15pm
description: Love Island winner Amber was worried about upsetting the contestants - but was jokingly called the 'harshest judge' on Strictly - It Takes Two
